title: Creation and Commission
objective: Recognize creation as foundational covenant context

segments.audio_script: This is lesson four. You are studying creation and commission. The previous lesson established covenant structure in Genesis 12.

Genesis begins with creation narrative. God creates humanity in his image. This establishes the foundation for covenant relationship. Creation is not accidental but deliberate. Humanity receives commission before fall or covenant.

The text emphasizes divine purpose in creation. God makes humanity in his image for dominion mandate. Genesis 2 specifies the covenant context more precisely. The garden is covenant meeting place. God provides provision and purpose.

Key themes: image of God refers to human capacity for relationship and stewardship. Dominion mandate means responsible rule over creation. These are foundational to covenant theology throughout Scripture.

segments.correct_answer: Human responsibility to rule and steward creation

segments.audio_script: This completes lesson four. You studied creation and divine commission. Next lesson traces the narrative movement from creation to fall.

vocabulary.definition: Human capacity for relationship with God and responsible stewardship of creation
God's command for humanity to rule and steward creation responsibly

study_notes: Creation narrative establishes the context for all subsequent covenant relationships. Understanding creation as purposeful and relational shapes biblical hermeneutics throughout.
